data.event: According to Forbes.com, in 2007 the village ranked as the 36th fastest growing suburb in the United States.

event.title: was commonly known as "Frankfort Station" after the opening of the Joliet & Northern Indiana Railroad through the township in 1855

data.event: It was commonly known as "Frankfort Station" after the opening of the Joliet & Northern Indiana Railroad through the township in 1855, though the official plat of the community dated March 1855 shows the name as "Frankfort".

It was commonly known as "Frankfort Station" after the opening of the Joliet & Northern Indiana Railroad through the township in 1855, though the official plat of the community dated March 1855 shows the name as "Frankfort".
The first pioneers came to Frankfort in the early 1830s by means of the Des Plaines River from the southwest and by wagon from the east along the Sauk Trail, a roadway that still exists today.
